{"step_by_step_thinking": "Muscle contraction is initiated by a complex interaction of proteins. Calcium ions play a crucial role in this process. They do not bind directly to actin or myosin, which are the main contractile proteins. Instead, calcium ions bind to the protein troponin, which is part of the thin filament along with actin and tropomyosin.
